Pre-Game Insights: How Arshdeep Singh and Jasprit Bumrah fare with the new ball against England in the Powerplay could go a long way in deciding the outcome of the T20 World Cup semi-final match.
India would hope to turn the tables on defending champions England when they clash in a blockbuster second semi-final of T20 World Cup in Guyana on Thursday, June 27, 2024.
India are looking the favourites as they cruised into the semi-finals, winning all the six matches they played so far.
England were beaten by Australia and barely managed to squeeze into the Super 8s stage on the net run rate.
India have struggled in the big knockout games in ICC events in the last decade.
India are likely to retain the same combination even though doubts still persist over Virat Kohli's role as the opener.
Jasprit Bumrah (11 wickets) and Arshdeep Singh (15 wickets) will need to once again make early inroads against a powerful England batting line-up.
England's openers Jos Buttler and Philip Salt are capable of destroying any bowling attack in the Powerplay.
The Indian spin trio of Kuldeep, Jadeja and Axar Patel will have their task cut against the trio of Jonny Bairstow, Moeen Ali and Harry Brook.
England's most dangerous batter in the death overs is Liam Livingstone.
A fit-again Jofra Archer will be a big threat with the ball.
Overall, India have a good record against England in T20 World Cups with four wins out of six games played.
Overall, in T20 Internationals, there is not much of a difference in the head to head record, with India leading 12-11 in 23 games played.
